Circuit Transpilation (fd_greens.main.transpilation)

transpile_into_berkeley_gates(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, circ_label: str, savefig: bool = True) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Transpiles the circuit into native gates on the Berkeley device.

This is the main function in this module and calls the other functions as subroutines. The basis gates are assumed to be \(X_{\pi/2}\), virtual Z, CS, CZ, and C0iXC0. The transpilation procedure depends on the circuit label. This function consists of the following steps:

  1. Permute and add SWAP gates (transpile_by_permutation)

  2. Transpile three-qubit gates (transpile_3q_gates)

  3. Transpile two-qubit gates (transpile_2q_gates)

  4. Transpile single-qubit gates (transpile_1q_gates)

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit to be transpiled to native gates on the Berkeley device.

  • circ_label – The circuit label, e.g. '0u', '0d' etc.

  • savefig – Whether to save the circuit figures.

Returns

circ_new – The circuit after transpilation to the native gates on the Berkeley device.

transpile_by_permutation(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, circ_label: str, savefig: bool = False) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Performs transpilation by permutation based on the circuit label.

This function is a wrapper of permute_qubits, which inserts SWAP gates at specific start and end positions, which are predetermined based on the circuit label. The goal is to permute qubits so that all multi-qubit gates act on adjacent qubits.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit to be transpiled by permutation.

  • circ_label – The circuit label.

  • savefig – Whether to save the circuit figure after transpilation.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after transpilation by permutation.

transpile_3q_gates(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, circ_label: str, savefig: bool = False) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Performs three-qubit gate transpilation based on the circuit label.

This function is a wrapper of convert_ccz_to_cixc, which transpiles the CCZ gates in four-qubit circuits into C0iXC0 along with additional single- and two-qubit gates.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit on which CCZ gates need to be transpiled.

  • circ_label – The circuit label.

  • savefig – Whether to save the circuit figure after transpilation.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after transpiling the CCZ gates.

transpile_2q_gates(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, circ_label: str, savefig: bool = False) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Performs two-qubit gate transpilation based on the circuit label.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit on which two-qubit gates need to be transpiled.

  • circ_label – The circuit label.

  • savefig – Whether to save the circuit figure after transpilation.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after transpiling the two-qubit gates.

transpile_1q_gates(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, circ_label: str, savefig: bool = False) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Performs single-qubit gate transpilation based on the circuit label.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit on which single-qubit gates need to be transpiled.

  • circ_label – The circuit label.

  • savefig – Whether to save the circuit figure after transpilation.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after transpiling the single-qubit gates.

permute_qubits(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, swap_inds: Sequence[int], start: Optional[int] = None, end: Optional[int] = None) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Permutes qubits in a circuit and inserts SWAP gates.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit to be transpiled.

  • swap_inds – The qubit indices to permute.

  • start – The start index of qubit permutation.

  • end – The end index of qubit permutation.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after transpilation.

convert_ccz_to_cixc(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Converts CCZ gates to C0iXC0 gates along with other gates.

Each CCZ gate in the original circuit is decomposed into \(\text{CiZC}\ \text{CS}^\dagger(q_0,q_2)\). The \(\text{CS}^\dagger(q_0,q_2)\) gate is then decomposed into \(\text{SWAP}(q_0,q_1) \text{CS}^\dagger(q_1,q_2) \text{SWAP}(q_0,q_1)\), and only one of the SWAP gates is further decomposed into the form in arXiv:2111.04572 depending on whether it is an even (the one after is decomposed) or odd occurrence (the one in front is decomposed). The latter decomposition is for further simplification of the gates by simplify_swap_gates and simplify_czxcz.

Parameters

circ – The circuit on which CCZ gates are to be called to C0iXC0 gates.

Returns

circ_new – The circuit after CCZ gates are called to C0iXC0 gates.

convert_swap_to_cz(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, q_pairs: Optional[Sequence[Tuple[int, int]]] = None, reverse: bool = False) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Converts SWAP gates to CZ and \(X_{\pi/2}\) gates except for the ones at the end.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit on which the SWAP gates need to be transpiled

  • q_pairs – The qubit pairs on which the SWAP gates are converted.

  • reverse – Whether the \(X_{\pi/2}(q_0)X_{\pi/2}(q_1) \text{CZ}\) sequence is applied in the reversed way.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after converting the SWAP gates.

convert_1q_to_xpi2(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Converts single-qubit gates \(H\), \(X\) and \(Y_{\theta}\) to \(X_{\pi/2}\) and virtual \(Z\) gates.

The conversion rules used in this function are:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}H &\to Z_{\pi/2} X_{\pi/2} Z_{\pi/2}\\X &\to X_{\pi/2} X_{\pi/2}\\Y_\theta &\to X_{\pi/2} Z_{\pi-\theta} X_{\pi/2} Z_{-\pi}\\U_3(\theta, \phi, \lambda) &\to Z_\phi X_{\pi/2} Z_{\pi-\theta} X_{\pi/2} Z_{\lambda-\pi}\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
Parameters

circ – The circuit on which single-qubit gates need to be transpiled.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after transpiling hte single-qubit gates.

combine_1q_gates(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, qubits: Optional[Iterable[int]] = None) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Combines certain single-qubit gates to identities on given qubits.

The combination rules used in this function are:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}H\ H &\to I\\X\ X &\to I\\X_{\theta} X_{-\theta} &\to I\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
Parameters

  • circ – The circuit on which 1q gates are to be combined.

  • qubits – Qubit indices on which 1q gates are to be combined.

Returns

circ_new – The circuit after certain 1q gates are combined.

combine_2q_gates(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, qubit_pairs: Optional[Iterable[Tuple[int, int]]] = None) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Combines certain two-qubit gates into identities on given qubit pairs.

The combination rules used in this function are:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}\text{CZ}\ \text{CZ} &\to I\\\text{SWAP}\ \text{SWAP} &\to I\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
Parameters

  • circ – The circuit on which certain two-qubit gates need to be combined.

  • qubit_pairs – An iterable of the qubit pairs on which two-qubit gates are combined.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after certain two-qubit gates are combined.

transpile_subcircuit(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, qubits_trans_map: Mapping[Sequence[int], Sequence[str]]) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Transpiles a circuit by transpiling the subcircuits.

This function is carried out by:

  1. Split the circuit into subcircuits

  2. Apply the simplification functions

  3. Merge into the main circuit.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit to be transpiled.

  • qubits_trans_map – A dictionary with qubit indices as the keys and transpilation function strings as the values.

Returns

circ_new – The circuit after transpiling on the subcircuits.

split_subcircuit(inst_tups: Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]], qubits_subcirc: Sequence[int]) → Tuple[List[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]], List[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]], List[int]][source]

Splits a subcircuit from a circuit.

This function is called as a subroutine of transpile_subcircuit.

Parameters

  • inst_tups – The circuit that need to be split in instruction tuple form.

  • qubits_subcirc – The qubit indices of the subcircuit.

Returns

  • inst_tups_sub – The subcircuit instruction tuples.

  • inst_tups_main – The main circuit instruction tuples.

  • barr_loc – The main-circuit locations of the barriers in the subcircuits.

merge_subcircuit(inst_tups_sub: Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]], inst_tups_main: Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]], barr_loc: Sequence[int], qubits: Sequence[int]) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit[source]

Merges a subcircuit into the main circuit.

This function is called as a subroutine of transpile_subcircuit.

Parameters

  • inst_tups_sub – Instruction tuples of the subcircuit.

  • inst_tups_main – Instruction tuples of the main circuit.

  • barr_loc – Locations of the barriers in the main circuit.

  • qubits – Qubit indices of the subcircuit.

Returns

inst_tups – The instruction tuples after merging the subcircuit and the main circuit.

simplify_xzpi2x(circ: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]]) → Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]][source]

Simplifies \(X_{\pi/2}Z_{\pi/2}X_{\pi/2}\) to \(Z_{\pi/2}X_{\pi/2}Z_{\pi/2}\) on a single-qubit circuit.

Parameters

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after the simplifying \(X_{\pi/2}Z_{\pi/2}X_{\pi/2}\).

simplify_xzpix(circ: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]]) → Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]][source]

Simplifies \(X_{\pi/2}Z_{\pi}X_{\pi/2}\) to \(Z_{\pi}\) recursively on a single-qubit subcircuit.

Parameters

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after simplifying \(X_{\pi/2}Z_{\pi}X_{\pi/2}\).

simplify_z_gates(circ: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]]) → Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]][source]

Parameters

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after simplifying series of Z gates.

simplify_swap_gates(circ: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]]) → Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]][source]

Simplifies SWAP gates by exchanging the qubits between two SWAP gates and removing the SWAP gates.

Parameters

circ – A circuit on which SWAP gates need to be simplified.

Returns

circ_new – The new circuit after simplifying the SWAP gates.

simplify_czxcz(circ: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]]) → Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]][source]

Parameters

Returns
